thread.title: Returning skipper Danny Batth: I’ve never worked so hard
thread.title_full: Returning skipper Danny Batth: I’ve never worked so hard

title: Returning skipper Danny Batth: I’ve never worked so hard
text:
Tweet 
The Brierley Hill-born centre-half had been out since May after suffering a stress fracture to his left foot. 
And the stopper revealed his joy at his return in which Wolves gained a point away at Preston North End at the weekend and victory over Fulham on Tuesday evening. 
Batth said: “I was playing catch-up having missed the start of the season but I have worked probably the hardest I ever have in my career over the summer. It is good to have got back and not really feel too far away from it. 
“We have taken four points from two games and kept a clean sheet at Fulham and that is something I am proud of.” 
And the defender said he aims to help develop younger players in the dressing room despite himself being only 25. 
“I have always been told I have an old head on young shoulders,” he laughed. What do you think? Log in and leave your thoughts below 
“At 25 I am probably still learning myself, but I have come a long way at the club. 
“There are younger lads either side of me and hopefully I can be a voice to help them through games when it is needed.” 
And the skipper said he is pleased that Wolves have been able to dominate a team like Fulham and begin looking up the league table rather than over their shoulders. 
“I think we have shown in recent seasons that we have been one of the best teams in the country for possession stats in away games. 
“We showed that by going to a good technical side like Fulham and being able to dominate possession and score goals. More on this story:
